Detailed Description

is a dispatcher which has implemented an active wait loop. To release the active wait, the method Done() must be called.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher::StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher (  const AbstractStackMsgArgMapContainer *  arg_map_container = 0  ) 
 

Parameters:
msg_map The message map holds all messages, to which the dispatcher should listen to.

virtual StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher::~StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

void StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher::Abort (   )  [inline]
 

This method is called from another dispatcher when a call's disconnection confirmation arrived. Then, the dispatcher will call Abort() from outside in order to indicate that the active wait loop was terminated due to a call's disconnect and actually terminates the dispatcher by calling Done().

void StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher::Init (  const AbstractStackMsgArgMapContainer *  arg_map_container  )  [inline, protected]
 

virtual BOOLEAN StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher::IsAborted (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

IsAborted() checks if the a call was disconnected while the active wait dispatcher was waiting for messages.

Returns:
TRUE - If the preemptive active wait dispatcher was terminated by the disconnection of the call.
FALSE - Otherwise.
